intro: Navarretia californica, commonly known as the California navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Navarretia californica has small, linear leaves and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. It is often found in areas with cool, temperate climates and is an important component of local ecosystems.
